qas.question: How large is Nanjing, in miles?
Where does the Yangtze River flow in Nanjing?

answers.text: past the west side and then north side

qas.question: How far is Nanjing from Shanghai, in miles?
How far is Nanjing from Beijing?
What is the name of the area of land around Nanjing?

context: Nanjing, with a total land area of 6,598 square kilometres (<a0_0>2,548 sq mi<a0_0/>), is situated in the heartland of drainage area of lower reaches of Yangtze River, and in Yangtze River Delta, one of the largest economic zones of China. The Yangtze River flows <a1_0>past the west side and then north side<a1_0/> of Nanjing City, while the Ningzheng Ridge surrounds the north, east and south side of the city. The city is 300 kilometres (<a2_0>190 mi<a2_0/>) west-northwest of Shanghai, 1,200 kilometres (<a3_0>750 mi<a3_0/>) south-southeast of Beijing, and 1,400 kilometres (870 mi) east-northeast of Chongqing. The downstream Yangtze River flows from Jiujiang, Jiangxi, through Anhui and Jiangsu to East Sea, north to drainage basin of downstream Yangtze is Huai River basin and south to it is Zhe River basin, and they are connected by the Grand Canal east to Nanjing. The area around Nanjing is called <a4_0>Hsiajiang (下江, Downstream River) region<a4_0/>, with Jianghuai (江淮) stressing northern part and Jiangzhe (江浙) stressing southern part. The region is also known as Dongnan (東南, South East, the Southeast) and Jiangnan (江南, River South, south of Yangtze).
